meanings.definition: The act of going or moving from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: Her waygoings to school are always punctual.
meanings.sent2: The map showed the waygoings to the nearest town.
meanings.sent3: His waygoings around the office always make us smile.
meanings.sent4: The river's waygoings through the valley were majestic.
meanings.sent5: The waygoings of the ants were fascinating to watch.

meanings.definition: The course or direction in which one is going.
meanings.sent1: The waygoings of the hikers led them up the mountain.
meanings.sent2: She carefully planned her waygoings through the maze.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's waygoings in the park were full of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The waygoings of the stars across the sky were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The waygoings of the river twisted and turned through the forest.

meanings.definition: The behavior or conduct of a person.
meanings.sent1: His waygoings at the party were polite and friendly.
meanings.sent2: The teacher praised the student's waygoings in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat's waygoings around the house were always curious.
meanings.sent4: Her waygoings in the community earned her respect.
meanings.sent5: The waygoings of the birds in the garden were a joy to watch.
